questions.question: True or false? There is a legal requirement to provide information on food labels.

choices.answer: True
False

questions.question: Which of the following does not have to be put onto the label of a product?

choices.answer: Name of food
List of ingredients
Traffic light labelling (green, amber, red)
Weight or volume

questions.question: Which of the following would need to be included in the name of the product, if relevant?

choices.answer: Dried
Salted
Smoked
All of the above
in ascending order of weight
in descending order of weight
in alphabetical order
in order the ingredient was added to the product

questions.question: How should the list of ingredients be presented?
Complete the following sentence. Allergens need to be highlighted in the ingredients list....

choices.answer: when their weight is over a certain amount.
when the foods are mostly based on the allergen.
only when the product is being sold in supermarkets.
at all times.
it shows that they may be unsafe to consume
it shows that they have been rigorously tested for safety

questions.question: What does an E-number of an additive signify?
Which two of the following best describes a 'best before' date?

choices.answer: They are mostly about quality
Foods are not safe to eat after this date
They are found mostly on perishable foods
They are found mostly on frozen, dried and canned foods

questions.question: Which two of the following best describes a 'use-by' date?

choices.answer: Foods are not safe to eat after this date
They are found mostly on perishable foods
They are about quality, not safety
They are found mostly on frozen, dried and canned foods
Energy, fat, saturates, carbohydrates, sugars, protein, salt
Energy, fat, saturates, protein, salt, carbohydrates, sugars
Energy, protein, carbohydrates, sugars, fat, fibre, sodium
Energy, protein, fat, sugars, saturates, fibre, sodium

questions.question: Which of the following describes the order of nutrients on the back of pack labelling?
True or false? Reference intakes on food labelling are based on an average adult female requirements.

choices.answer: True
False
